column14: Well differentiated cells (Grade 1) look similar to normal cells and are usually slow growing, while poorly differentiated cells (Grade 3) look very different than normal and are fast-growing.
column15: Well differentiated tumors (Grade 1) look similar to normal cells and are usually slow growing, while poorly differentiated tumors (Grade 3) look very different than normal and are fast-growing.
column16: The existing wording describes the Elston-Ellis-Grading system incorrectly; instead of cells alone histological and cytological features are used to the semiquantitative scoring
column17: description of the grading should be corrected

column16:
BreastCancerPresenceStatementModel
This concept should have beside BreastSite and BreastCancerType a third  subconcept BreastCancerBiologicalSubtype (AJCC Cancer Staging Manual, Eighth Edition, Breast Chapter, p 615)

column14: The stage of a breast cancer. Different staging systems use different staging groups, so there are currently no terminology bindings associated with this class.
column16:
BreastCancerStage

A new concept for StageType should be added, comprising the AnatomicalStage, the ClinicalPrognosticStage and the PathologicalPrognosticStage. Then a terminologyy binding should be possible

column14: Clinical assessment of lymph nodes for presence of cancer cells in staging the N category in cancers.
column15: Pathological assessment of lymph nodes for presence of cancer cells in staging the N category in cancers.
column16:
BreastPathologicalLymphNodeInvolvement

The existing wording is wrong
column17: description of the pathological lymph node assessment should be corrected

column16:
DCISNuclearGrade

DCISNuclearGrade is conceptional equivalent to BreastCancerHistologicalGrade. Both concepts should be arranged as subconcepts under HistologicalGrade
column17: Hierarchy of grading for invasive and non.invasive cancers should be regarded

column14: HER2 receptor status as determined by single-probe or dual-probe Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization (FISH)
column15: HER2 receptor status as determined by single-probe or dual-probe Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization (FISH, CISH, BDISH)
column16:
HER2byFISH

not only a single in-situ hybridization method is in use
column17: description of in-situ-hybridization methods should be added

column16:
HER2byFISH

The concept describes an Her2-Status, equivalent to HER2ReceptorStatus (for which equivocal should be added). Comparing the concept HER2ByIHC the ISH concept should express the interpretation of the ISH result: amplified, not amplified, equivocal according the current rules (AJCC Cancer Staging Manual, Eighth Edition, Breast Chapter, p 621)
column17: target of the model for HER2ByFISH should be modified

column4: Logical Models and Value sets and Diagrams
column16:
Ki-67NuclearAntigen

The model uses a Value set, which describes the interpretation of the measured (or estimated) values. Due to the current instability of the interpretation threshold it would be wise to add the ki-67 index (percentage of positive cells) to the model. Furthermore this concept should be grouped with the cultigen-expression tests  and the „classical biomarkers“ to the PathologicalPrognosticStageModel, which has not yet been defined (see my comment #3)
column17: expand the Ki-67NuclearAntigenModel by the measurement value of Ki-67 Index.

column15: Post-coordinate the type of staging into this Observation profile as an Observation component holding the various types, e.g., pTNM, cTNM, etc.
column16:
BreastCancerStageProfile

It's important to post-coordinate the TNM type to allow explicit association between the stage abnd its type and make it possible for a service consuming the data conveyed by a resource instance compliant with this profile, to fully understand its meaning.
column17: Post-coordinate the type of staging (e.g., pTNM).

column16: Recommend leveraging the FDA/CDISC Breast Cancer Therapeutic Areas User Guide (TAUG) and the data elements, value sets identified by FDA, biopharmaceutical companies, NIH and academia for clinical trials.  This user guide is also being leveraged for the re-use of EHRs in breast cancer trials.  ( https://www.cdisc.org/standards/therapeutic-areas/breast-cancer )
Coordinate representations/modeling for consistency with other components of FHIR.
column17: Align with other components of FHIR

column16: According to the documentation this is a US Realm specification, right?
